Description: Selection of gear ratio.0 / Gear Factor /FAct: Usage of gear ratioadjusted with GEARnum/GEARdenom1 / 200 /200: 2002 / 400 /400: 4003 / 500 /500: 5004 / 1000 /1000: 10005 / 2000 /2000: 20006 / 4000 /4000: 40007 / 5000 /5000: 50008 / 10000 /10.00: 100009 / 4096 /4096: 409610 / 8192 /8192: 819211 / 16384 /16.38: 16384A change of the reference value by the specifiedvalue causes one motor revolution.Modified settings become active immediately.
Parameter address via fieldbus: CANopen 3026:6hModbus 9740Profibus 9740CIP 138.1.6ModbusTCP 9740EtherCAT 3026:6hPROFINET 9740

Description: Gear ratio selection.Switches between two gear ratios:Value 0: Use gear ratio defined by parameterGEARratioValue 1: Use gear ratio from parametersGEARnum2/GEARdenom2Modified settings become active immediately.
Parameter address via fieldbus: CANopen 3026:EhModbus 9756Profibus 9756CIP 138.1.14ModbusTCP 9756EtherCAT 3026:EhPROFINET 9756

Description: Numerator of gear ratio.Gear ratio = GEARnum / GEARdenomThe new gear ratio is applied when the numeratorvalue is supplied.Modified settings become active immediately.
Parameter address via fieldbus: CANopen 3026:4hModbus 9736Profibus 9736CIP 138.1.4ModbusTCP 9736EtherCAT 3026:4hPROFINET 9736

Description: Denominator of gear ratio.See description GEARnum
Parameter address via fieldbus: CANopen 3026:3hModbus 9734Profibus 9734CIP 138.1.3ModbusTCP 9734EtherCAT 3026:3hPROFINET 9734
